Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us. 

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server. 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________

3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us. 

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server. 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Danylo,

Thank you for getting back to us.

Please make sure to perform a snapshot of the Virtual Machine before proceeding with the steps:
1. Download the new VM from the link below.https://www.endpointprotector.com/epp/virtual-app-email
2. Import them into the environment using this document:
https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_Virtual_and_Hardware_Appliance-User_Manual_EN.pdf
3. Please activate the trial license on the new server.
4. Please make sure that the EPP server version from the old server is the same with the version from the new server (if not, they need to be updated in order for the migration to be successful)
5. Once both servers have the same version, please go to the old server under "System Maintenance > System Backup V2". Here please:- click on "Create",- name the backup and add a description.- Click on "Save".- Copy the "System Backup Key" into a notepad.
- click on "Yes, I have saved the system backup key".- Wait for the backup to complete.- download the backup

Please note that the Backup V2 option does not migrate the logs to the new server, and these will still be present on the old server.

Once this steps are finished, we can schedule a remote session for next week to import the system backup into the new server.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
